projects.title: Resume
projects.summary: It might look like another resume, but I think it's a work of art. I built it using web technologies so that I can easily add new experiences, skills etc. I can add and remove pieces by clicking them on the fly and create a link to the "new" version . It started as an excuse to learn angular but ended up being an incredibly useful creation.

projects.title: multiSSH
projects.summary: Under the supervision of Professor Paul Lu I developed an application designed to overcome TCP bandwidth issues in the presence of packet loss over wide area networks. It was able to increase speed by nearly 2x and contributed to Paul's presentation at the High Performance Computing and Simulation conference in 2015.

projects.title: Mylyn
projects.summary: As part of a national program for distributed development between undergraduate students I implemented a complex data structure for Mylyn. It created a mapping from tasks to reviews and an inverted index of it. I also designed a user interrface that displayed the contents of the data structure.

projects.title: Kelsey Prud'homme
projects.summary: This is a website I built for a friend to gain more web development experience. I was attempting to learn pure PHP so I didn't use any frameworks. The website has a basic CMS that allows her to upload images and create galleries of her projects.

projects.title: Blockster
projects.summary: A friend and I were bored during a night off at an undergraduate research conference (UROC) and decided we should try making a game. It's a simple platform jumper that works on a phone or desktop.

projects.title: Algomations
projects.summary: I absolutely love math and algorithms but nothing rivals combining that with making them look nice. And so I make algomations where I learn a new algorithm (usually math related) and create an animation to show it!

projects.title: Quadcopter
projects.summary: During the summer of 2014 a friend and I decided it would be awesome to build a quadopter. We did our research and were able to build one from "scratch". I just wish I was better at flying it!

projects.title: Computer Vision
projects.summary: One of the coolest course projects I've ever done. As a group we applied machine learning algorithms like neural networks and support vector machines to a computer vision problem. We attempted.

projects.title: Flash Game
projects.summary: Try and find that flash game I made for info pro ages ago........

experience.title: Program Manager Intern
experience.summary: Reimagined piloting Bing Ads features across an entire engineering partner group and operations enabling more pilots run at scale with increased user engagement. Discovered dependencies across Bing Ads teams to switch from an in-house version control system to Git. Designed an experience enabling more data driven visualizations with capabilities to export to Excel.

experience.title: Intern Ambassador
experience.summary: As a volunteer, hosted networking events for over 50 students at the University of Alberta. Mentored several students by tutoring computer science and assisting with job applications.

experience.title: Program Manager Intern
experience.summary: Delivered a feedback mechanism enabling efficient collection and triage for thousands of user feedback items. Designed a new experience for the product's grid controls significantly increasing over 400 users' productivity. Gathered feedback from the product team to create a product monitoring dashboard. Developed relationships across 6 teams in order to push development of features quickly.

experience.title: Student Software Developer
experience.summary: Constructed a SharePoint media hub to store and serve video to any device for over 10,000 employees. Developed an IT site to route vacation requests, organize meeting workspaces and centralize document control. Redesigned the extranet and improved its controls increasing the impact of client interaction. Improved C#/.NET invoicing software by implementing import and export with Excel saving over an hour per invoice.

experience.title: Computer Programmer
experience.company: Alberta Ingenuity Centre for Machine Learning
experience.summary: During my second internship I created an implementation of OpenStreetMaps in Java. My implementation was able to download map tiles, cache them and pre-fetch them in order for an optimal viewing experience

experience.title: Computer Programmer
experience.company: Alberta Ingenuity Centre for Machine Learning
experience.summary: This was my first real introduction to computer sciences rather than simple software development. Before this I had written games in Adobe flash, built simple websites with PHP and a few other things. At AICML I implemented a series of algorithms ranging from Djkstra's to a convex hull algorithm combined with a "point-in-shape" algorithm. These are tools in analysing social networks which are simply graphs of relationships.

education.title: Bsc with specialisation in Computing Sciences
Thesis based MMath with specialisation in Computer Sciences
